clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Amlodipine/Benazepril in Reducing Left Ventricular Hypertrophy in Patients With High Risk Hypertension
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Amlodipine/Benazepril in Reducing Left Ventricular Hypertrophy in Patients With High Risk Hypertension

brief_summary.textblock: Left ventricular hypertrophy (LVH) increases the risk of cardiovascular morbidity and mortality in patients with high blood pressure, compared to those without LVH. Reduction of left ventricular mass (LVM) with antihypertensive agents is associated with improved clinical outcome. This study will evaluate the effects of amlodipine/benazepril in reducing LVM in patients with high risk hypertension.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in left ventricular mass index after 52 weeks

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in left ventricular mass after 52 weeks
Change from baseline in diastolic function after 52 weeks
Change from baseline in aorta function assessed blood pressure measurements after 52 weeks
Change from baseline in markers of fibrosis and increased heart size after 52 weeks

Exclusion Criteria:

- Myocardial infarction or stroke within 6 months
- Presence of cranial aneurysm clips, coronary artery metal stents and pacemakers
- Pregnant or lactating females
- Cancer within the last 5 years
